definition: to be short of the full amount
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom

sentences.english: And they said unto Moses, Thy servants have taken the sum of the men of war which are under our charge, and there lacketh not one man of us.
sentences.chinese: 對他說，僕人權下的兵已經計算總數，並不短少一人。

sentences.english: The goods may be spoiled or the weight gets short during transit.
sentences.chinese: 貨物可能在運輸途中受到損壞或者重量短少。

sentences.english: We find that the case shows a shortage in weight.
sentences.chinese: 我們發現每箱重量都短少。

sentences.english: In the course of my life he broke my strength; he cut short my days.
sentences.chinese: 他使我的力量，中道衰弱，使我的年日短少。

sentences.english: The fund wants a hundred pounds of the sum needed.
sentences.chinese: 資金的需要額數還短少一百英鎊。

sentences.english: He weakened my strength in the way; he shortened my days.
sentences.chinese: 他使我的力量中道衰弱，使我的年日短少。

sentences.english: Man that is born of a woman is of few days, and full of trouble.
sentences.chinese: 人爲婦人所生，日子短少，多有患難。

sentences.english: We found that the case show a shortage in weight.
sentences.chinese: 我們發現每箱重量都短少。

sentences.english: A: We came up about two cases short.
sentences.chinese: 我們發現大概短少了兩箱。

sentences.english: The shortage in net weight of delivered cargo was due to insufficiency of originally dispatched weight.
sentences.chinese: 到貨淨重短少，系原發貨重量不足所致。

sentences.english: Shortage to be settled as per relevant clause.
sentences.chinese: 短少按照有關條款處理。

sentences.english: Upon inspection, we found some cases were broken due to poor packing.
sentences.chinese: 經檢查，我方發現每箱重量都短少。

definition: variant of 那麼|那么[na4 me5]
to impair/to degrade/to decrease/to reduce/to weaken/to detract from/impairment (e.g. of financial assets)
to fall short in one's payments/to lack/to be short of
to be deficient in sth/to be short of sth (supplies, money etc)
variant of 靡費|靡费[mi2 fei4]
